post_with_time: "60% of interns become full-time employees -Hiring paid interns is an easy process that transforms how companies build their talent pipeline. The numbers speak for themselves - 60% of interns move into full-time roles, creating a direct path to permanent employment.¹Students show remarkable success rates. Within just three months of graduating, 87% of former interns land jobs, demonstrating how these programs effectively kickstart careers.²Companies can bring in eager individuals who contribute creative ideas and tackle various projects right away. These interns often become valuable long-term team members while providing fresh perspectives.¹Here's what makes paid internships a smart investment:- Cut down hiring and training costs- Get an extended look at potential hires- Keep employees longer- Speed up new hire training¹For students, it's real work experience that counts. They learn on the job, build professional skills, and make connections that matter. This hands-on experience helps them transition smoothly from classroom to workplace.²Our fall 2025 CO-OP work term hiring process is open and ongoing. "The Intern" – A Lesson on the Untapped Potential of Experienced TalentA while back, I watched the movie *The Intern*, and it resonated deeply with me. It wasn’t just entertainment—it felt like a reflection of my own story. Having worked with an international airline that upheld exceptional business ethics, a professional team, and world-class HR standards, I know firsthand the value of experience, passion, and dedication.This film is a reminder of something we often overlook in the corporate world: the immense potential of experienced professionals who are eager to restart their careers.Many retirees—myself included—are not just willing but passionate about contributing again. We bring decades of expertise, stability, and a strong work ethic that can create synergy when combined with fresh, qualified talent.Yet, in Pakistan (and elsewhere), thousands of skilled professionals retire every year—many of whom are ready to continue working immediately or after a short break. The best part? This experienced talent is often available at a fraction of the cost of hiring a fresh but inexperienced resource.So, here’s my appeal to HR professionals and business leaders:- Revisit your hiring strategies – Don’t let institutional knowledge walk out the door.- Leverage the power of mentorship – A mix of youth and experience drives innovation.- Consider flexible roles – Many retirees seek meaningful work, not just a paycheck.If you haven’t watched *The Intern*, I highly recommend it—not just as a movie but as a case study on why experience matters. And if you’re looking for someone who brings both expertise and passion, well… I’m retired, ready, and eager to contribute!Let’s rethink how we value talent—because age is just a number, but experience is an asset.hashtag#HRhashtag#TalentManagementhashtag#TheInternhashtag#ExperienceMattershashtag#SecondCareerhashtag#RetiredButNotDone Khalid SiddiquiKhalid Siddiqui "The Intern" – A Lesson on the Untapped Potential of Experienced TalentA while back, I watched the movie *The Intern*, and it resonated deeply with me. "We need 4 years of experience." But how do I get those 4 years without being given a chance?As a recent graduate actively applying for data analyst roles, I've run into a common challenge: job postings asking for years of experience — even for entry-level positions.When I asked for advice, many people kindly suggested internships. But here's the catch: most internships are designed for students who are currently enrolled, and as a graduate, I often don’t meet the eligibility criteria.So, here I am — willing to learn, motivated, and already building real-world projects — but still struggling to bridge that “experience” gap.To recruiters, hiring managers, and professionals in the industry:📌 How can early-career candidates like me gain that crucial experience when the doors seem closed?I'd love to hear your thoughts, advice, or opportunities you know of that support recent grads beyond the traditional internship path. Let's make it easier for the next wave of talent to grow.#OpenToWork#DataAnalytics#CareerAdvice#EntryLevelJobs#EarlyCareer#JobSearch Ketan ChawareKetan Chaware "We need 4 years of experience." A 21-Year-Old’s Leap into the Business World!We’re ambitious. We’re digital natives. We take risks.But let’s be honest, Gen-Z doesn’t always get it right in business, especially in growth and strategy roles.I’ve seen it first-hand. I’ve been it. And I’ve learned it (the hard way) 💥We want impact, hate long feedback loops, and think Canva + ChatGPT = business plan 💻⚡But here’s the truth 👇💡 Growth is not instant.At Growwcap, I built funnels that flopped before one finally clicked.💡 Strategy is not aesthetics.At Younity, I managed 3,000+ interns and crossed ₹50L in sales—not by going viral, but by obsessing over systems.💡 Execution > Ideas.At ProfitPenny and EarnYoung, I learned that cold calls, client follow-ups, and updates aren’t “uncool”—they’re necessary.💡 Legacy businesses need love too.At my family business, I learned that real innovation comes from blending tradition with tech—not ditching the past, but building on it.Now, I’m here to level up—learning the deeper side of business: strategy, partnerships, growth, and long-term thinking.Not to hustle harder, but to build smarter.If you're Gen-Z navigating the business world (or hiring one of us 😉), I’d love to hear your experience.Drop your honest takes in the comments 👇Let’s talk real.hashtag#GenZInBusinesshashtag#GrowthMarketinghashtag#StartupLifehashtag#StrategyMattershashtag#BusinessDevelopmenthashtag#CareerJourneyhashtag#LinkedInVoiceshashtag#YoungProfessionalhashtag#PersonalBrandinghashtag#MastersUnion Dhruv SangaiDhruv Sangai A 21-Year-Old’s Leap into the Business World!We’re ambitious. Bei uns intern nennen wir diese vier jungen, junggebliebenen und sehr charmanten Herren das 𝐋𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐤-𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐦. Sie machen aber viel mehr beiICM Personal AG.BeiMarc,Premton,EdonundMariolaufen viele Jobs zusammen: von Kommissionierern über Verkaufstalente, Chauffeure CE, Lagerarbeiterinnen und Lagerarbeiter, Mitarbeitende in der Produktion, Servicetechniker bis hin zu Lackierern – die Liste ist lang.Was die vier wirklich auszeichnet? Company DescriptionComing together is a beginning, keeping together is progress and working together is a success”. As quoted by Edward Everett is our motive as well. TEN is a virtual start up working for the betterment of business education. It is a community-based edu-tech group with an objective for quality education. A strong motive, clear cut goals and sound knowledge about the field are the unfaltering weapons an entrepreneur requires. We believe strongly in the qualities of an entrepreneur, passion, perseverance and progress!Why Join us?🔹️Location-Free & Dynamic – Perform your tasks from anywhere while managing your own hours.🔹️Hands-on learning- Gain direct exposure to HR tasks and challenges by actively engaging in real-world scenarios.🔹️Certificate of completion & Letter of Recommendation upon the completion.Role DescriptionThis is a full-time remote role for HR Intern at TEN. The intern will be responsible for✅️Identify hiring needs and execute recruitment plans.✅️Manage different online sourcing platforms for recruitment.✅️ Review applications and interview processes.✅️ Coordinate with the candidates proactively.✅️Be actively involved in recruitment by preparing job descriptions, posting ads and managing the hiring process.Who can apply?✔️Students and recent graduates interested in HR.✔️Strong communication skills.✔️Able to work for 2 or 3 months remotely.🚀Join us in shaping the future at TEN. Dear HR,Let’s have a quick chat. Before you post that job ad this week, please double-check the title.If the role requires 2 years of solid experience, then let’s call it what it is — Junior Officer, Associate, Graduate Trainee, Entry-level, whatever fits. But please, not Intern.Because here’s the thing:An intern is someone stepping into the real world — fresh out of school or transitioning into a new field — hoping to gain practical experience.They’re not supposed to come fully loaded with 24 months of experience, KPIs met, tools mastered, and buzzwords memorized.Let’s not confuse “learning on the job” with “already doing the job.”Hiring the right talent starts with clarity and honesty. Mislabeling roles doesn’t just mislead applicants — it hurts your brand, wastes everyone’s time, and filters out the very people internships are meant to support.Say it with me: This week, I will do better.For the culture. For the talent. For the future workforce.Jisike. Adetunji OdunayoAdetunji Odunayo Dear HR,Let’s have a quick chat. Dear Hiring Managers,Please stop asking for +10 years of industry work experience for entry-level jobs. Ask if the young interns have passion, dedication, and care about helping your customers more than anything else.I think you will get better results hiring kind people who care about others instead of chasing unicorns who lived their entire life with the sole purpose of furthering their career and only caring about making more money.It’s time to reframe what “qualified” looks like. A willingness to learn, a heart for service, and a genuine belief in the company’s vision should carry weight in hiring decisions. Especially for early-career roles.When you prioritize depth of character over depth of résumé, you open the door to individuals who are often the most eager to contribute, grow, and stay loyal to your mission. These are people who may not have a long track record yet, but who carry values that align deeply with your company’s purpose.Hire with your heart!Sincerely,All interns Dear Hiring Managers,Please stop asking for +10 years of industry work experience for entry-level jobs. Dear Job Seekers Beware – Fake Job Posts Alert! 🚨If you're a fresher or college student actively looking for jobs or internships, please be extra cautious about posts that ask you to:🚫 "Comment your email address to apply"🚫 Offer high salaries with no official application link🚫 Provide vague or no recruiter details🚫 Conduct "virtual interviews" without proper scheduling or authenticationRecently, I came across a post claiming to offer jobs atAtoswith no formal process, contact person, or official link. Always verify opportunities by visiting the company's official website or LinkedIn page.✅ Tips to Stay Safe:👉Apply only through official career portals👉Connect with verified recruiters on LinkedIn👉Never share personal info like your email, phone number, or resume in public comments👉Cross-check interview invites before attendingLet’s support each other by reporting suspicious posts and sharing authentic opportunities 🙌Stay smart. Doctors — Want 10x Results with 1x Effort? Exciting Internship Opportunity in Talent Acquisition!Are you a recent BTech/BE graduate eager to explore the world of Talent Acquisition?Join Intellikart Ventures LLP as an HR Intern for a 4-month remote internship!▫️Gain hands-on experience in sourcing, screening, and interview coordination.▫️Work closely with senior HR leaders and the founding team.▫️Build real-world recruitment skills and grow in a dynamic environment.A great opportunity for freshers passionate about HR and hiring!To apply, share your resume atprajwal@intellikart.in/careers@intellikart.inLet’s shape the future of hiring together!Intellikart Ventures LLPhashtag#HRInternshiphashtag#TalentAcquisitionhashtag#BTechFreshershashtag#BEfreshers Exciting Internship Opportunity in Talent AcquisitionAt Intellikart Ventures LLP, we're on a mission to revolutionize the way companies hire by combining innovative recruitment strategies with advanced technology. We're looking for passionate interns to join our HR team for a 4-month internship.This is a great chance for recent BTech/BE graduates who are eager to explore the dynamic world of Talent Acquisition. Extremely sad to see how cheap the professionals are getting in the name of new media. I understand the market is hard but you can't exploit talent with rotten budgets.Are there still organizations hiring experienced & versatile talent with a decent pay range? This makes me sad.With all those responsibilities, the paycheck is basically 1/3rd of what it should be. Expertise doesn't come for free. I'm sure a lot of people are facing the same issue as me, shrunken paychecks.In fact, recently, a random beat officer began messaging me weird stuff out of the blue. Bros, where has your mental filter gone?We already don't have a lot of women leaders to look up to & to see the culture stooping down to this, it's crushing.Interns are exploited for months with peanuts. Extremely saddened by this current state of affairs. No wonder people are jamming up the directory for Peon jobs, it's probably their small act of resistance.I'm only aware of 3 people whose mothers work & everyone else I'm aware of go with the housewife tag, including the women in my own family. Setting such a terrible precedent for the upcoming generation.Women are an important part of the workforce, this is how creative roles are treated. I'm crying tears of blood. The organizations are as supportive of my veteran skills as my mother was of my choice of college & street dogs.Is this the recession, someone just confirm please! Finishing my academic career at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln has also marked the end of my time as a student intern at HuskerVision. I can’t begin to say enough about how much this role has taught me in the last two years and how many unforgettable opportunities I was given with it. Hiring someone who had no idea on how to use a camera was probably not the safest decision, but it will definitely not be forgotten. I owe you all more than a thank you for the guidance and inspiration to make great things in this pursuit of a career. Looking back on the projects from my time here, I think this senior tribute best exemplifies my gratitude, and represents how much of a foundation I’ve gained. Because of the impactful two years working around the great people at HuskerVision, I can’t wait to see what’s next. For HR InternJob Title: HR InternCompany: Wonton Consulting Private Limited (WCPL)Location: RemoteDuration: 2 MonthsStipend: Performance-basedAbout WCPL:Wonton Consulting Private Limited (WCPL) is a fast-growing HR consulting and talent solutions firm dedicated to transforming how organizations manage and develop their workforce. We specialize in recruitment, HR strategy, talent development, and workforce planning across various industries. At WCPL, we are passionate about nurturing young talent and creating a learning environment that blends theoretical knowledge with real-world HR practices.Internship Overview:WCPL is looking for a dynamic and proactive *HR Intern* to support our Human Resource operations. This 2-month internship is ideal for students or recent graduates eager to gain practical experience in core HR functions within a professional consulting setup. Performance will be evaluated throughout the internship to determine eligibility for a stipend.Key Responsibilities:- Assist in daily HR operations and administrative tasks- Support recruitment processes including job postings, screening resumes, and scheduling interviews- Maintain and update HR databases and employee records- Help organize employee engagement initiatives and documentation- Assist in drafting HR reports and internal communications- Support learning and development initiativesRequirements:- Basic knowledge of HR functions and concepts- Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)- Good communication and organizational skills- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines- Enthusiasm to learn and contribute to a dynamic teamPerks & Benefits:- Stipend: Based on performance- Certificate of Completion- Letter of Recommendation (LOR) for outstanding contributors- Real-world HR experience and learning opportunities in a supportive environmentHow to Apply:Send your resume and a short cover letter toarchana@wontonconsulting.comwith the subject line:Application for HR Intern – WCPLjoining - 1st junehashtag#Hiringhashtag#Recruitmenthashtag#HRhashtag#humanresourcesmanagementhashtag#Freshershashtag#HRinternhashtag#Graduatedhashtag#Noidahashtag#Delhihashtag#indiahashtag#internshiphashtag#wcplhashtag#HRMhashtag#Openinghashtag#panindia Archana KashyapArchana Kashyap For HR InternJob Title: HR InternCompany: Wonton Consulting Private Limited (WCPL)Location: RemoteDuration: 2 MonthsStipend: Performance-basedAbout WCPL:Wonton Consulting Private Limited (WCPL) is a fast-growing HR consulting and talent solutions firm dedicated to transforming how organizations manage and develop their workforce. From Job-Hopping Without a Degree to Becoming a Data Analytics Engineer:How Life, Work, and Experience Shaped My PerspectiveIf someone had told me years ago that I’d be working in Data Analytics, I probably would’ve smiled, nodded, and thought:“That sounds too far-fetched.”Why? Because I never got a degree.Not that I didn’t try—I enrolled in Informatics Engineering, Accounting Information Systems, and English Studies. But family responsibilities always came first.No graduation. No degree.Just a long, winding path filled with hard-earned lessons.So I worked. I kept moving forward.I took on roles many overlook:💼 Business Development🏘️ Real Estate Agent✈️ Ticketing StaffEach taught me something—about people, pressure, and how businesses really operate.All while… I kept managing events.Since 2008, I’ve worked as an Event/Project Manager in parallel with every job.Not a side gig—a second career.For over 14 years, I’ve led events from small activations to large pop-culture conventions, managing teams of up to 50.From logistics to vendor negotiations, team coordination to real-time decision-making—I was in the thick of it.That experience taught me to:✅ Identify root problems✅ Adapt quickly✅ Manage expectations✅ Deliver results without chaosThose lessons became the backbone of how I handle challenges today:With structure, empathy, and clarity.Then came tech.I entered IT, starting from the ground up:🖥️ Junior IT Support at financial audit institution.🏛️ Intern at U.S. Embassy Jakarta🏦 Field Engineer under IBM JTII learned how systems run—from cables to code.That curiosity led to a pivot.I joined a data bootcamp, reskilled, and stepped into analytics.Now, with 3+ years in the data field, I’ve:🔧 Built and maintained pipelines🧹 Cleaned and validated data📊 Automated dashboards📬 Supported CRM/marketing segmentation❓ Turned business questions into data-backed decisionsWhat sets me apart is perspective.I’ve been on the ground and in the war room.I know what happens when strategy meets reality—and how data can bridge the gap.I’m open to work.Whether it’s a full-time role or project-based, I bring:⚙️ Business insight📈 Technical know-how🧠 People-first leadershipIf you’re looking for someone who sees the whole picture,solves problems without tunnel vision,and brings clarity to complexity—Let’s connect.My journey hasn’t been linear.But every twist made me better.To those walking a similar path:You’re not behind—you’re becoming.Let’s build something meaningful together.---hashtag#OpenToWorkhashtag#DataAnalyticshashtag#DataEngineerhashtag#CareerJourneyhashtag#BootcampGradhashtag#NoDegreeSuccesshashtag#DataWithPurposehashtag#ReskillJourneyhashtag#ProblemSolverhashtag#StoryThroughDatahashtag#LeadershipInChaoshashtag#LifeExperienceMattershashtag#JobSearchhashtag#FreelanceDataEngineerhashtag#Hiringhashtag#RemoteWorkhashtag#TechWithHeart Hello there! I'm thrilled you've come across my profile. I am currently looking for a 1- year apprenticeship program starting from September 2025.If you're hiring interns or apprentice in the field of data science or business intelligence, don't hesitate to reach out – I'm eager to explore future opportunities!Let me share a bit about myself: Although I am French, I grew up and spent most of my life in Hong Kong, China. However, in 2021, after graduating, I decided to start a bachelor’s degree in Artificial Intelligence at Groningen University- (Netherland), as it matched my 2 main goals: 1. to prepare for a future engineering career 2. to continue evolving in an international environment. After 2 years of very high-level academic courses, I realized that I aspired to find a better balance between theoretical learning and practical projects. The unique French system of alternating study (apprenticeship) convinced me to join ECE, a well-known computer science school.Thanks to my studies and various projects, I have acquired a solid foundation in programming (C, Python, C++, C#, API), data (Python, SQL Server, T-SQL, Hadoop, Power BI), and AI (TensorFlow, PyTorch).My goal lies in utilizing data-driven insights to propel business success, and I'm enthusiastic about learning and improving my expertise in this field. If you are looking for a junior eager to learn, hardworking with a positive mindset and a strong ability to adapt and integrate into a team, feel free to connect, and together, let's navigate the dynamic world of data! Hiring Manual tester Intern- Work from home opportunityJob Title: Manual Tester InternDuration: 3–6 Months Internship with a possibility of extensionDepartment: Quality Assurance / Software TestingAbout the Role:We are looking for a detail-oriented and enthusiastic Manual Tester Intern to join our QA team focused on ERP solutions. This internship offers a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience in testing complex, enterprise-level software systems that support core business functions such as finance, supply chain, HR, and more.Key Responsibilities:Execute test cases to validate ERP modules including Finance, Inventory, HR, Sales, and Procurement.Identify, document, and track software defects using tools like JIRA or similar.Collaborate with the QA team, developers, and business analysts to understand ERP workflows and business logic.Perform functional, regression, integration, and usability testing of ERP applications.Assist in the preparation and maintenance of test documentation (test plans, test cases, test reports).Provide feedback to improve user experience and software performance.Education Requirements:Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree inComputer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, Electronics & Communication or a related technical/engineering fieldCandidates with educational backgrounds in Commerce, Accounting, or Business Administration who also have relevant IT or software testing knowledge are encouraged to apply (especially for finance/accounting module testing).Skills & Qualifications:Understanding of SDLC and STLC, especially in enterprise software environments.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Good understanding of ERP concepts or business processes is a plus.Familiarity with web-based applications and user interfaces.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Skills & Qualifications:Understanding of SDLC and STLC, especially in enterprise software environments.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Good understanding of ERP concepts or business processes is a plus.Familiarity with web-based applications and user interfaces.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Exposure to test case management and bug tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, TestRail) is advantageous.What You’ll Gain:Experience working with ERP systems and real-world business processes.Insight into how QA supports high-stakes enterprise software development.Mentorship from experienced QA professionals and ERP consultants.Exposure to Agile and iterative development methodologies.A strong foundation in software testing within a domain-rich environment.Interested candidates share cv Hiring managers aren't ghosting you for fun. They're not looking to unleash workplace soft skill disasters. And honestly? We get it.From LinkedIn:89% of failed hires are due to bad soft skills.92% of talent practitioners say that soft skills are as critical or more critical than hard skills.Only 41% of companies have a process to assess them.Most are being hired based on what they know and let go based on who they are. You might be able to learn technical skills to get a job, but without soft skills, you could lose it. No one wants to work with the guy who thinks"teamwork" means everyone else does all the work, or the intern who emails about work like it's a WhatsApp conversation:"Hae, plz do the thing asap thx"Introducing ZydiiMicrolearning soft skills training for African teams, delivered to your phone.From communication and teamwork to time management and leadership, we help teams drop bad work habits without putting them to sleep.Because let's be real, no one has time for a 3-hour PowerPoint presentation on emotional intelligence.Our Microlearning Magic1. Fun, brief modules (2 to 10 minutes)2. Mobile-first, so you can learn on the go3. Real African workplace scenarios with no corporate speak4. Functional, not preachy, and sometimes humorous5. Don't wait for HR to "speak with you in confidence."Get started with Zydii 👉https://lnkd.in/dZVXHZi6Practice soft skills as if your career depends on it, because it does.SloganHard skills get you hired. How the hell am I supposed to justify hiring an intern or recent graduate in 2025?I already hear the agentic AI consortium laughing me out of timeline relevance as they vibe-code their way to another few million ARR (or at least a viral LinkedIn post).I’m not the only one worried.Aneesh Raman’s recent opinion inThe New York Times(https://lnkd.in/eNtFe_Rt) does a great job explaining how the outsourcing of simple tasks to AI, rather than juniors, removes a critical way that young workers gain experience.If I didn’t write hundreds of 160-character long promotional SMSs every month forJosé Soaresback in 2013, or labour over monthly performance reports with (admittedly basic) Excel analysis, I doubt my LinkedIn ads would be among LinkedIn’s top 1% performers a decade later.We're fighting over academic talent (see the recentHarvard Universityvs Trump international student drama). But I wonder what we’ll do with that talent once they graduate. Deeptech research may consider itself safe, but after reading AI 2027 (https://ai-2027.com/) I wonder how long good “research appetite” will protect them.I don’t have answers to the above grand challenges, but I do discuss how marketing can tackle this today with clients, as well asGrowthMentormentees, regularly. My advice:▶️ Split marketing into three pillars: Strategy, Production (writing content, building landing pages, launching digital campaigns), Operations (arranging events, submitting award proposals, setting up CRM workflows).▶️ Your Marketing leader should be doing all three. While significant time is spent on strategy, leadership should produce and run some operations to maintain perspective.▶️ Experts handle the bulk of production. These can be in-house FTEs, agencies, freelancers or even AI agents, but the goal is top quality driven by deep experience.▶️ Operations is where interns and recent graduates can shine because mindset and execution, rather than hard-skills and knowledge, are the success factors. Exposure to domain experts and real-world scenarios accelerates the transition from academia to a career.The above should help fresh faces into the marketing workforce, upskill rapidly through exposure, and benefit from their creative thinking.It might not be as efficient over the short term as “AI everything”, but I’d letKlarnaCEOSebastian Siemiatkowski's recentBloomberginterview end with a note on cost vs. quality:Siemiatkowski said that [an all-in on AI for customer support] strategy isn’t the right fit any more. “As cost unfortunately seems to have been a too predominant evaluation factor when organizing this, what you end up having is lower quality,” he said. “Really investing in the quality of the human support is the way of the future for us.”How do we blend quality, cost-efficiency, and social obligation to the next generation of talent together? How to Find Investment Banking Internships(Without Campus Support)If you're not from a target college, breaking into IB can feel overwhelming, because most large firms hire through campus placements.But here's the good news:There’s a smarter, more strategic way to get in, through boutique and mid-market firms.Here’s how you can go about it1. Start by Reaching Out to Professionals• Target analysts, associates, or VPs at boutique or mid-market IB firms• These firms often hire off-cycle interns through networks and referrals• Focus on building real connections, not just asking for a job2. Ask for Informational InterviewsRequest 15–20 mins to understand:• Their career journey• Their day-to-day work• Industry insights you can’t find on Google• This builds trust and shows you’re genuinely interested3. Share Your Work to Prove Commitment• Work on a basic financial model, do industry research, and turn it into a short presentation• Share it and ask for feedback, this shows you’re not just interested, but prepared• When you ask for help, they should already know you're capable4. Ask for Referrals the Right Way• Once you've built a relationship, ask if they know anyone hiring interns• Make it easy: share your resume and be clear about what kind of role you’re looking forWant to get started?I've created an Outreach Template that you can use to message professionals at every step.Click the link to download it now.https://lnkd.in/dNjt_HdtMain thing is to be consistent. One conversation can change everything. How to Find Investment Banking Internships(Without Campus Support)If you're not from a target college, breaking into IB can feel overwhelming, because most large firms hire through campus placements.But here's the good news:There’s a smarter, more strategic way to get in, through boutique and mid-market firms.Here’s how you can go about it1. Start by Reaching Out to Professionals• Target analysts, associates, or VPs at boutique or mid-market IB firms• These firms often hire off-cycle interns through networks and referrals• Focus on building real connections, not just asking for a job2. Ask for Informational InterviewsRequest 15–20 mins to understand:• Their career journey• Their day-to-day work• Industry insights you can’t find on Google• This builds trust and shows you’re genuinely interested3. Share Your Work to Prove Commitment• Work on a basic financial model, do industry research, and turn it into a short presentation• Share it and ask for feedback, this shows you’re not just interested, but prepared• When you ask for help, they should already know you're capable4. Ask for Referrals the Right Way• Once you've built a relationship, ask if they know anyone hiring interns• Make it easy: share your resume and be clear about what kind of role you’re looking forWant to get started?I've created an Outreach Template that you can use to message professionals at every step.Click the link to download it now.https://lnkd.in/dNjt_HdtMain thing is to be consistent. One conversation can change everything.

Human Resources InternAbout company:-“Coming together is a beginning, keeping Together is progress and working together is a success”. As quoted by EdwardEverett is our motive as well. TEN is a virtual start up working for the Betterment of business education. It is a community-BasedEdu-Tech group with an objective for quality Education. A strong motive, clear cut goals and Sound knowledge about the fieldare the unfaltering Weapons an entrepreneur requires. We believe strongly In the qualities of an entrepreneur, Passion,Perseverance and Progress!About internship:-Responsibilities:-* Identify hiring needs and execute Recruitment plans.* Manage different online sourcing Platforms for recruitment.* Review applications and Interview processes.* Coordinate with the candidates Proactively.* Develop recruitment related Documents.* Support the development and implementation of HR initiatives and systems.* Provide counseling on policies and procedures.* Be actively involved in recruitment by preparing job descriptions, posting ads and managing the hiring process.* Create and implement effective onboarding plans.* Develop training and development programs.* Assist in performance management processes.Skills Required:-* Excellent written and verbal communication, strong editing skills.* Superlative commitment, flexibility and motivation to stay focused and generate high quality leads.* Familiarity with MS excel (analysing spreadsheets and charts).* Excellent communication and Negotiation Skills, ability to deliver engaging presentations.* Ability to collaborate with team members, Self-Motivatedand organized.* Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or relatedfield.* Experience in sales, marketing or related field.* Strong communication skills and IT fluency.* Ability to manage complex projects and multi-task.Excellent organizational skills.* Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty.* Proficient in Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.* Comfortable using a computer for various tasks.Only those candidates can apply who:-* Are available for an Unpaid internship for 3 months. (90 days)* Can start the internship immediately.* Have relevant skills and interests.Perks:-* Experience Certificate,Letter Of Recommendation (Based On Performance) on Successful Completion of Internship Tenure.* Star Performer Certificate (Based On Performance).* Flexible work hours.* Duration:- 90 days ( Unpaid internship)* Location:- Remote. INTERNSHIP APPLICATION FOR THE PLATINUM AND TAYLOR HILL LP VIRTUAL INTERNSHIP PROGRAMME 3.0.The Hiring Manager,I write to express my interest as an intern in the Pth Virtual Internship Programme 3.0.It is fact that legal education is a rather complex one not limited to academic activities and the like,and at such opens its horizons to other activities that enhances professional development, of which internship is an ideal,thus indulging one to work towards personal developments,skills and experience geared towards one's intended line of specialty.I am currently a 200 level student, pursuing a degree in law at Imo State University, Owerri, Nigeria.My academic journey has been one loaded with great developments through researches and writings, coupled with my academic commitment and dedication,evident in my glowing CGPA,and an award of excellence as the overall winner at a chamber Essay Writing Competition.With great interests in Advocacy and Human rights activism, Corporate law,and the evolving Ai and the law,I am confident that this platform will serve as a resourceful catalyst to these interests,through insightful experiences and mentorships while benefiting immensely from my invaluable skills and abilities as I am a quick learner,an eager personality and one open to wholesome opportunities.Thanks for considering my application,I anticipate a favourable response. If you’re hiring interns to “save money,”You’re already out of compliance.Let’s clear up the biggest myth:Interns aren’t free labor.And your intent doesn’t override the law.Here’s what most companies get wrong:1. Stipend isn’t optional: If the intern is doing actual work (not just learning), a stipend is ethically and legally expected. Unpaid internships ≠ “great exposure.” That’s exploitation.2. Offer letters must be formal: An internship offer should mention duration, stipend, reporting manager, and work expectations. An email saying “Join from Monday” doesn’t count.3. Working hours matter: You can’t make interns work 9–6 like full-time employees. Especially without the legal structure of employment. Intern ≠ invisible employee.4. Interns ≠ escape route for compliance: Don’t onboard interns just to avoid PF, ESI, or contract formalities. Labour departments have started cracking down on this in urban zones.5. Colleges are watching too: Many reputed institutions blacklist companies that exploit students during internships. Your employer brand is on the line.Bottom line:If interns are doing real work,They deserve real respect and real structure.Internship ≠ loophole.It’s a legal relationship, not a casual favor.P.S. If your “internship program” involves Excel sheets, 9-hour shifts, and zero pay - you didn’t hire an intern; you hired a ghost employee. khushi Atwalkhushi Atwal If you’re hiring interns to “save money,”You’re already out of compliance.Let’s clear up the biggest myth:Interns aren’t free labor.And your intent doesn’t override the law.Here’s what most companies get wrong:1. Interns Are Not Coffee Runners They’re Future CEOs in TrainingMany companies still see internships as a form of cheap, temporary labor, but this mindset is outdated and costly.Interns represent untapped potential.They are the future innovators, managers, and executives.Treating them like low-level assistants misses a critical opportunity to shape your organization’s success.Why Internships Matter More Than EverWith fast-changing markets and new business models, companies need agile and adaptable leaders.Internship programs that are strategic and thoughtfully designed become talent accelerators transforming raw potential into real leadership.How to Build a Program That Works🎯 It Starts with a PlanDevelop a clear structure: Define what skills and experiences interns will gain. Set goals for their contribution and learning milestones. Treat interns as early-career professionals rather than temporary helpers.🤝 It Grows with MentorshipPair interns with mentors who can provide guidance and feedback. Mentorship builds confidence and helps interns navigate their roles and the company culture.🚀 It Flourishes with Real Work and Honest FeedbackAssign interns meaningful projects that impact business outcomes. Encourage an environment where feedback is frequent, specific, and supportive. This combination boosts skills and motivation.The ResultInterns who feel valued and challenged are more engaged and productive. They become natural advocates for your brand and are more likely to join full-time, reducing your hiring risk.More importantly, you create a leadership pipeline that feeds your company with skilled and culturally aligned talent ready to take on tomorrow’s challenges.An internship program isn’t an expense it’s an investment in your company’s future. The interns you nurture today will shape your leadership tomorrow. I’m sharing a case from my work with a major IT company where we built an HR system that now fills 90% of roles internally. This post breaks down the practices that made it possible, why they work, and what I recommend to IT teams in 2025 to achieve similar results. It’s not about fast hiring - it’s about building a mature culture, enabling internal mobility, and growing talent from within. Job Title: Social Media Marketing InternLocation: RemoteAbout GAO Tek Inc.GAO Tek Inc. is a leading supplier of advanced electronics and network test & measurement equipment for the tech industry. With over 20 years of experience and a global team, we offer interns the opportunity to gain real-world experience in a fast-paced, international environment.Profile Overview:We are looking for a creative and motivated Social Media Marketing Intern to join our team. Nivedita Das NarayanNivedita Das Narayan Leaving it here, you HR folks, for you to mull, introspect and revise your Intern hiring attitude aka policies; yes, in India, specially. Harlan Cohen on Instagram: "The worst is when you have an unpaid internship and then you have to pay for the college credits you earn by doing the internship. Essentially you’re paying to work for someone. #internships #intern" Leaving it here, you HR folks, for you to mull, introspect and revise your Intern hiring attitude aka policies; yes, in India, specially.

Let's talk about those "We're hiring freshers!" posts flooding your feed lately... 🚩You know the ones:• Professional photo of someone(usually a somewhat pretty girl) in formal attire 👔• Big corporate logo as the backdrop 🏢• Caption screaming "Comment 'INTERESTED' to get shortlist!" ✍️• Zero job description, no requirements, no application processHere's what's actually happening:These aren't legitimate recruitment efforts. They're engagement traps designed to harvest your data and boost someone's profile metrics. The person in the photo often doesn't even know their image is being used for this purpose.As someone who values genuine professional connections and has seen the real hiring process from both sides, this trend is concerning. Job seekers, especially freshers, deserve better than to have their hopes manipulated for social media engagement.Think about it: No reputable company asks candidates to "comment interested" as part of their application process.Real recruiters provide:• Clear job descriptions• Qualification requirements• Application instructions• Company informationCredit toShubhamfor highlighting this issue.If you're a job seeker, especially a fresher, please protect your time and data:• Request complete job details before engaging• Check if the poster is actually connected to the company they claim be part of• Look for verification on the company's official career page• Be wary of posts asking only for comments rather than proper applicationsLet's keep LinkedIn a place for real professional opportunities, not engagement farming.And a note to theLinkedInTrust & Safety Team... Please look into this issue.hashtag#ProfessionalNetworkinghashtag#JobSeekershashtag#RecruitmentEthicshashtag#JobSearchhashtag#CareerAdvicehashtag#ContentModeration Subhranil DasguptaSubhranil Dasgupta Let's talk about those "We're hiring freshers!" posts flooding your feed lately... 🚩You know the ones:• Professional photo of someone(usually a somewhat pretty girl) in formal attire 👔• Big corporate logo as the backdrop 🏢• Caption screaming "Comment 'INTERESTED' to get shortlist!" ✍️• Zero job description, no requirements, no application processHere's what's actually happening:These aren't legitimate recruitment efforts. LinkedOut Diaries™ – Entry #022Title: How to Survive a 4-Round Interview Process That Ends in Ghosting (Spoiler: You Don’t)I went through four rounds.FOUR.Four interviews. Four fake laughs. Four outfit changes I couldn’t afford to wash again. One unpaid task that took three hours and a small piece of my soul.And you know what I got at the end of it all?Absolutely nothing. Not even a “sorry.”Just a slow, painful ghosting that haunts me like a bad situationship I thought was “different.”Let’s break it down, shall we?ROUND ONE: The Flirt.They slid into my inbox with “We were really impressed with your application!”And I believed them. Like a fool.I showed up smiley and prepared. I said words like “synergy” and “impact” while sitting on a broken chair. I thought, “Oh wow, they like me.”Ha. Cute.ROUND TWO: The Vibe Check.“Let’s meet the team!”I met the team. I charmed the team. I emotionally bonded with the team. I started imagining what my Slack profile photo would look like.They said things like:“You’re a strong candidate.”“We love your energy.”Translation: they were already hiring someone else but felt bad about it.ROUND THREE: The Task.“You’ll just need to complete a short assignment.”It was neither short, nor sane.It was 6 pages of strategy, three pages of writing, a spreadsheet, and a tiny existential crisis.I did it.Because I’m desperate. Because I’m a try-hard. Because I still believe work should feel meaningful.I even edited it in Canva so it would look pretty while they ignored it.ROUND FOUR: The Final Interview™I put on my good earrings.I said the word “passionate” four times.I referenced their mission statement. I even said I liked teamwork.I was lying through my teeth, but I did it with a smile because that’s what capitalism demands.And then?Nothing.No rejection. No “we’ve moved on.” No “thank you for your time.”Just ✨ghosted✨ like I never existed.And the worst part?I STILL CHECKED MY EMAIL FOR WEEKS.Like a fool. Like a love-struck intern waiting for their boss to notice them.The level of emotional whiplash this process gave me could fund an entire therapy arc.Conclusion?If your hiring process is going to be longer than a mini-series, the bare minimum you can do is send a freaking email at the end.This wasn’t just rejection.It was a slow-motion heartbreak served cold and silent.And now I walk through life with a permanent dent in my hope.So yeah, I survived. Barely.And if you're reading this while waiting to hear back from your own Fourth Round Fiasco™, just know:You deserved better.You still do.hashtag#LinkedOutDiarieshashtag#GhostedAfterRoundFourhashtag#HireMeOrDon’tButSaySomethinghashtag#ThisIsABreakupPostNowhashtag#OpenToWorkAndEmotionalReparations Mitchelle WambuiMitchelle Wambui LinkedOut Diaries™ – Entry #022Title: How to Survive a 4-Round Interview Process That Ends in Ghosting (Spoiler: You Don’t)I went through four rounds.FOUR.Four interviews. Meet Mohanish, our super-sharp intern from Atlas Skilltech University, currently pursuing his MBA in Marketing & Digital Marketing – and bringing fresh energy to the Synapse team!While his heart beats for marketing strategy and consumer behavior, at Synapse, Mohanish is diving into the delivery side of executive search – connecting with candidates, decoding industry dynamics, and soaking up insights on how top talent thinks and moves.🗣️ “What I love most is interacting with a variety of people across industries and locations – it gives me a front-row seat to how different candidates analyze roles, make decisions, and what truly motivates them. It’s like real-time consumer psychology!” he shares.From understanding market trends to identifying behavior personas, Mohanish is learning how executive search is a powerful tool in shaping brands from the inside out – by hiring the right leaders.🎧 Fun Fact: He’s a full-on music geek – whether it’s Hip Hop or Opera, Mohanish can vibe to just about anything. (We’re thinking of handing him the office playlist next... 🎶)🎯 Career Dream? Working closely with a brand to craft innovative marketing strategies that connect deeply with audiences.We’re loving Mohanish’s curiosity, enthusiasm, and fresh perspective – and can’t wait to see the mark he’ll make in the world of marketing and beyond!Sweni KapadiaJolapamo OlabisiMohanish NagleOnanuga EstherAditi DaftariAnanya NaikAtrayee MukhopadhyayPrisha AjmeraShruti Srivastava@vaishnavi bahakarKashmala SiddiquiOpemidimeji OsatoyinboAndhika L.hashtag#InternSpotlighthashtag#LifeAtSynapsehashtag#ExecutiveSearchhashtag#TalentTalkshashtag#FutureCMOhashtag#MarketingMeetsHiringhashtag#AtlasSkilltechUniversityhashtag#CareerGoals Synapse Search PartnersSynapse Search Partners Meet Mohanish, our super-sharp intern from Atlas Skilltech University, currently pursuing his MBA in Marketing & Digital Marketing – and bringing fresh energy to the Synapse team!While his heart beats for marketing strategy and consumer behavior, at Synapse, Mohanish is diving into the delivery side of executive search – connecting with candidates, decoding industry dynamics, and soaking up insights on how top talent thinks and moves.🗣️ “What I love most is interacting with a variety of people across industries and locations – it gives me a front-row seat to how different candidates analyze roles, make decisions, and what truly motivates them. Networking as a fresher in the job market can feel challenging, but it's very doable with the right approach. Here are practical steps to build your network:1. Leverage Your Existing ConnectionsTalk to lecturers, classmates, and alumni — they may have job leads or know someone hiring.Ask for referrals — a warm introduction is often more effective than cold outreach.2. Use LinkedIn EffectivelyCreate a professional profile with a clear headline and summary.Connect with industry professionals, recruiters, and company employees.Engage with posts by commenting or sharing insights to become visible.3. Attend Career Events and WorkshopsUniversity career fairs, webinars, and industry meetups are goldmines for networking.Follow up with people you meet: send a polite message or email thanking them and expressing interest.4. Join Professional GroupsLook for WhatsApp, Telegram, or Facebook groups related to your field (e.g., tech, accounting, marketing).Also consider professional associations or student chapters (e.g., IEEE, ISK, PRSK, etc.).5. Volunteer or InternEven unpaid roles can build experience and introduce you to professionals who might recommend you later.6. Be Curious and Ask QuestionsWhen meeting professionals, ask about their career paths, challenges, and advice for beginners.People often enjoy talking about themselves and appreciate genuine interest.7. Stay in TouchDon’t disappear after connecting. Share updates, congratulate people on milestones, or just check in occasionally. We’re hiring! 🙌We are hiring a Business Associate Intern in my team, and if you’re good at it and you like it, it could turn into a full-time job faster than you can say “cash back” or “Joko AI”.So if you (or your cousin’s roommate’s friend’s dog walker) want to:▶ Join a small and ambitious team with an entrepreneurial mindset: own your projects, lead your accounts (for real, no bullshit)▶ Work with top-tier advertisers like Leroy Merlin, Décathlon, Sephora, Uber, Galeries Lafayette▶ Play with a loooooot of data and sharpen your sales game (Excel and pitch, your new superpowers)▶ Help us scale Joko from 4M to 100M users and rethink the future of shopping…then this might just be your next move.Curious? Ping me, or reach out to our dream teamEva Levy,Susy Bonnacier, orRaphaëlle Humbert, for the behind-the-scenes scoop 🤓Psssst: we are also organizing a meet-us session on the 17th of June, 2025. We’re hiring! 🙌We are hiring a Business Associate Intern in my team, and if you’re good at it and you like it, it could turn into a full-time job faster than you can say “cash back” or “Joko AI”.So if you (or your cousin’s roommate’s friend’s dog walker) want to:▶ Join a small and ambitious team with an entrepreneurial mindset: own your projects, lead your accounts (for real, no bullshit)▶ Work with top-tier advertisers like Leroy Merlin, Décathlon, Sephora, Uber, Galeries Lafayette▶ Play with a loooooot of data and sharpen your sales game (Excel and pitch, your new superpowers)▶ Help us scale Joko from 4M to 100M users and rethink the future of shopping…then this might just be your next move.Curious? Ping me, or reach out to our dream teamEva Levy,Susy Bonnacier, orRaphaëlle Humbert, for the behind-the-scenes scoop 🤓Psssst: we are also organizing a meet-us session on the 17th of June, 2025. We are looking for a Video Editing Summer Intern (Remote only)Job DescriptionAt Transmitio, we’re looking for a creative and detail-oriented Video Editing Intern to help us showcase our software applications through engaging video content. If you have a passion for visual storytelling, enjoy editing screen recordings, and want to create polished video demonstrations, this is the perfect opportunity for you!Qualifications:- Basic to intermediate video editing skills (experience with tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve is a plus)- Ability to record and edit clear, high-quality screen captures of software applications- Strong attention to detail to ensure smooth transitions, clear annotations, and professional pacing- Creativity in presenting software features in an engaging and easy-to-understand way- Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines- Willingness to learn and adapt to feedbackResponsibilities:- Record and edit high-quality screen captures of Transmitio’s software in use- Create concise, engaging video demonstrations showcasing software functionality- Add annotations, captions, and effects to enhance clarity and viewer engagement- Collaborate with the product and marketing teams to align videos with branding and messaging- Organize and maintain a library of video assets for future useSend your application to:info@transmitio.ioFor more information about us, go tohttps://www.transmitio.io/Application deadline: 30th May, 2025hashtag#jobshashtag#videoeditingjobs Our friends atTransmitio LLCare hiring a Video Editing Summer Intern (remote).Apply or share with someone who might be interested. POV: You're a TA specialist who just posted an intern opening…Excitedly logs into Naukri.Sees 200+ applications in an hour.Heart: Wow, so many interested candidates!Brain (after screening): 98% of them are completely irrelevant.So I did a little digging. Asked a few folks why they applied.Answer?"Saw an opening, so just applied."Ah yes, the age-old logic: "Don’t know what it is, but let’s apply anyway!"Meanwhile, recruiters out here trying to find that one gem among a sea of “just applied”s.No wonder there are so many memes about us not responding—we’re busy playing recruitment detective!So here’s a small takeaway for job seekers (especially freshers and interns):Read the JD. Apply only if it fits. A targeted application stands out way more than a hundred random ones.And to my fellow recruiters - you’re not alone in the chaos!hashtag#PersonalExperiencehashtag#recuiterlifehashtag#TalentAcquisitionhashtag#HiringHumorhashtag#JobSearchTipshashtag#RecruitmentRealityhashtag#TAstorieshashtag#LifeOfARecruiterhashtag#LinkedInHumorhashtag#InternHiringhashtag#ApplyWithPurpose Aiswarya KamalanAiswarya Kamalan POV: You're a TA specialist who just posted an intern opening…Excitedly logs into Naukri.Sees 200+ applications in an hour.Heart: Wow, so many interested candidates!Brain (after screening): 98% of them are completely irrelevant.So I did a little digging. Research Internship Opportunity at Greenamor VenturesBuilding a Sustainable Future, One Innovation at a TimeAre you deeply passionate about sustainability, eco-innovation, and creating impact through research? Greenamor Ventures is looking for research interns who are eager to contribute to building a greener planet through cutting-edge solutions in compostable materials, circular design, and sustainable packaging.Who We AreGreenamor Ventures is a climate-forward startup innovating in the field of biodegradable, compostable packaging. Our work blends materials science, environmental research, and product development to replace plastic with planet-friendly alternatives.What You’ll DoAs a Research Intern, you’ll:Work on material innovation using natural fibers and bio-polymersAssist in lab-scale testing, formulation, and degradation studiesConduct market and impact research for sustainable productsCollaborate with our R&D and design team on real-world projectsWho We’re Looking ForStudents or recent grads in Polymer Science, Materials Science, or similar fieldsStrong interest in sustainability, climate tech, and eco-designCurious, driven, and ready to explore future-facing challengesLocation: Hybrid (Prefer Keralites)Perks: Mentorship, Real-world Exposure, Future hiring preferenceJoin us if you want your research to mean something—to nature, people, and future generations. Some job search stories are tough, this is one of those.I frequently help single parents get hired and this story is one of the tougher ones.If you're not sure hope and prayer can make a difference, they still do.Earlier this year I helped a parent going thru divorce who now also had to find a job not by choice.That hurts.Besides divorce she had not worked outside the home in 15 years.That means no resume. Strike 1.No outside job experience to show dependability. Strike 2The rest of the story is that in a few days we developed a resume showing her computer skills & soft skills.She learned what is important to employers in choosing a new hire this year & how to present it that was impressive.She applied for a job in a medical clinic not as an office intern but as the person making appointments, scheduling, and greeting new patients.You probably think "no way that's going to happen!".That was in the afternoon. The next morning she was offered and accepted the job.Don't give up on your goal of getting hired. There is a job with your name on it that needs you.Let's connect, let's talk, let's get you hired, quickly.hashtag#hiringhashtag#encouragementhashtag#jobshashtag#careers Len Reitz, JSCLen Reitz, JSC Some job search stories are tough, this is one of those.I frequently help single parents get hired and this story is one of the tougher ones.If you're not sure hope and prayer can make a difference, they still do.Earlier this year I helped a parent going thru divorce who now also had to find a job not by choice.That hurts.Besides divorce she had not worked outside the home in 15 years.That means no resume. The Exploitation No One Talks About: Unpaid Internships in Pakistan’s Corporate SectorUnpaid internships are glamorized slavery and it’s time we say it like it is.Every year, thousands of students in Pakistan hustle for a foot in the door, only to land internships that promise exposure instead of fair compensation. In reality, what they’re exposed to is a broken system that thrives on free labor while preaching about “youth empowerment.”Let’s talk numbers. Convincing your family to let you work for free is hard enough but commuting, meals, clothing, and basic survival in a city like Lahore or Karachi easily costs PKR 15,000 to 30,000 a month. That’s the price students silently pay just to add a line on their CV.Companies that pride themselves on profitability still somehow expect students to work 9 to 5 without a single rupee in return. Not even a stipend for transport. No contribution to phone bills. Just the illusion of opportunity.Meanwhile, the ones who can afford these internships often belong to privileged backgrounds widening the already massive gap between the haves and have-nots. Talent becomes a matter of access, not merit.If a company cannot afford to pay interns, it shouldn't be hiring them in the first place. Period.It's time we stop romanticizing unpaid internships and start calling them what they are: corporate exploitation hiding behind fancy job titles. To the recruiters who say:“We’re looking for a unicorn who can do it all — but we’re only offering peanuts.”You’re not building a team.You’re casting for The Hunger Games: Corporate Edition.You want: ✔ 10 years’ experience (for an entry-level role)✔ A Master’s degree (plus certifications, just for fun)✔ Fluency in 4 languages✔ A willingness to “work under pressure” (aka burnout for free)And in return?✨ "Great exposure"✨ "Fast-paced environment"✨ “We’ll get back to you soon” — aka neverHR isn’t just about policies and payroll.It’s supposed to be about people.But somewhere along the way, y’all turned hiring into a talent show… where the prize is unpaid overtime.Let’s do better. Or at least pretend we’re trying.Because candidates talk. And the streets? They’re loud these days. 🫢hashtag#HRRealityCheckhashtag#RecruiterRanthashtag#HiringDoneWronghashtag#WorkCultureMattershashtag#LinkedInSatirehashtag#OpenToWorkButNotToBS Pierre SafiPierre Safi To the recruiters who say:“We’re looking for a unicorn who can do it all — but we’re only offering peanuts.”You’re not building a team.You’re casting for The Hunger Games: Corporate Edition.You want: ✔ 10 years’ experience (for an entry-level role)✔ A Master’s degree (plus certifications, just for fun)✔ Fluency in 4 languages✔ A willingness to “work under pressure” (aka burnout for free)And in return?✨ "Great exposure"✨ "Fast-paced environment"✨ “We’ll get back to you soon” — aka neverHR isn’t just about policies and payroll.It’s supposed to be about people.But somewhere along the way, y’all turned hiring into a talent show… where the prize is unpaid overtime.Let’s do better. Top Internship Platforms Compared (2025)👉 Here’s Why Startups Prefer InternBabaIn 2025, internship platforms are everywhere, but when it comes to finding the right talent—especially for startups—not all platforms deliver equally.While many portals focus on volume, InternBaba focuses on value—for both students and startups. Here's why founders, hiring managers, and early-stage teams are choosing InternBaba over the rest.🚀 1. InternBaba Sends Ready-to-Work InternsUnlike platforms that flood inboxes with resumes, InternBaba filters candidates based on skills, availability, and culture fit.✅ No time wasted on unqualified applications✅ Shortlists match your exact requirements💬 “InternBaba interns needed little onboarding. They were project-ready in week one.” — CTO, early-stage SaaS startup💰 2. It's Cost-Effective (for Startups AND Students)Startups love InternBaba because it’s free to post, free to hire, and doesn’t charge students either.→ No commission.→ No subscription traps.→ Just genuine access to talent, especially from Tier 2/3 cities.🧠 3. Smart Matching, Not Just Job ListingsInternBaba uses a skill-matching algorithm to connect students with relevant internships based on their actual strengths—not just keywords.That means:✔️ Faster hiring✔️ Lower churn✔️ Better output from Day 1🏠 4. Remote-First, Stipend-FriendlyStartups today work async, remote, and lean. InternBaba is built for this reality.80% of roles are WFH (Work From Home)Interns expect and value stipends, making collaboration smootherCompanies can access pan-India talent, not just local applicants🎓 5. Interns That Stick (and Grow)Many InternBaba interns go on to become long-term contributors.Because the platform promotes internships as a career launchpad, not just a resume filler, startups find motivated, loyal talent willing to grow with them.💬 “Our marketing intern became our full-time growth lead in 6 months. We arehashtag#hiringJob Title: Chef de Partie (CDP)Type: Full-timeExperience: 3–5 years in a professional pastry or chocolate kitchenRole Summary:As a Chef de Partie, you will take ownership of your section (with a focus on chocolate and/or pastry), executing La Folie’s signature desserts and bonbons while supporting new product development. You’ll be a key player in delivering consistency, finesse, and creativity in our daily mise en place, retail production, catering, and seasonal menus.Key Responsibilities- Lead the day-to-day operations of your assigned section.- Support R&D for seasonal menus, campaign products, and new launches- Uphold La Folie’s plating and product quality standards- Maintain hygiene, mise en place, FIFO systems, and section inventory- Train and mentor Commis or interns working under your guidance- Collaborate closely with the Head Chef and Sous Chef on planning and improvements- Follow all SOPs and kitchen systems diligentlyRequired Skills & Experience- 3–5 years of experience in a fine-dining, luxury patisserie, or bean-to-bar chocolate kitchen- An eye for detail, aesthetics, and visual consistency- Ability to multitask in a fast-paced, collaborative environment- Passionate about craft, quality ingredients, and creative expression- Basic understanding of costing and kitchen documentation is a plusHow to Apply- Send your CV, portfolio of work (if any) tohr@lafolie.in/info@lafolie.inhashtag#hiringhashtag#CDPhashtag#Chefhashtag#chocolatehashtag#lafolie We arehashtag#hiringJob Title: Chef de Partie (CDP)Type: Full-timeExperience: 3–5 years in a professional pastry or chocolate kitchenRole Summary:As a Chef de Partie, you will take ownership of your section (with a focus on chocolate and/or pastry), executing La Folie’s signature desserts and bonbons while supporting new product development. We're Hiring: Social Media & Copywriting Intern (On-Site | Jaipur, Rajasthan)Stipend: ₹5,000/monthDuration: 3 MonthsLocation: Jaipur, Rajasthan (On-site/Hybrid)Certificate: Internship certificate on successful completionIf your brain thinks in captions, you dream in scripts, and you love the idea of turning ideas into scroll-stopping content—then we’re looking for you.We’re a fast-growing creative team working with brands that want to be remembered. We're looking for a Social Media Intern who isn’t just here to post but to create culture, craft concepts, and write with fire.Your Role:Write scroll-worthy copy for posts, reels, and adsCraft short-form video scripts with viral potentialManage posting schedules, hashtags, and captions like a proBrainstorm and write killer ad concepts & campaign ideasAssist with creating client proposals that sell like magic(Bonus but optional) Edit trending reels using CapCut, VN, etc.You’ll love this if you:Are obsessed with Instagram, YouTube Shorts, and viral cultureCan write like a human (not a robot) and think like a storytellerHave a keen eye for what’s trending & what’s cringeKnow how to say more with less—and make it sound goodWant to actually learn, create, and be part of something coolPerks:Work on real brands, real campaigns, real impactLearn the inside world of creative advertising and brand buildingGet an Internship Certificate on completionGrow with a young, passionate, and bold teamLeave with a portfolio that gets you noticedHow to Apply:Send your resume, 2 writing samples (script/ad/post), and (if available) a link to your edited video or reel toThekahanikaars@gmail.com.Or just DM us with “I’m your next intern”—and we’ll take it from there. Well, well.Online shortlist → Offline showdown → Microsoft Office, Gurugram → Top 10 teams → Snagged the Trophy.From looking at the microsoft logo everytime I would open my laptop to standing right next to the building with it was created — Hackamania 2025 was nothing short of surreal.Just the rapturing aura of entering the building made us feel like we were going to be a part of something bigger, something that could actually make a differenceFrom yelling at each other over bugs and UI tweaks to sleeping on each other’s shoulders during last-minute builds, we became a team in the truest sense.The team together fit each other like the pieces of a puzzle.From underdogs with no expectations to champions on stage — we pulled off first place with sheer grit and glee.The anchors called out our oxymoronious name — BrainKnees — and in that instant, the room lit up with wild joy. We smiled, we cheered, and we’re still living in that moment of triumph.What did we build?We created a solution that wasn’t just needed, but demanded — one that replaces manual inefficiencies with automated, AI-powered decision-making.A tool built in Bharat, designed for the globe — applicable across diverse economic segments.I remember convincing my teamEkta AroraAgastsya Joshiwith least hope to just go on with the registration process“Let’s give it a shot — even if we don’t win.”And voila!We entered with empty bags, sweaty foreheads, and a palpitating heart and left with an enormous about amount of goodies, a beautiful trophy and a smile that showed all our 32 teeth.Thanks a ton to the entire team behind it :•	Reskill for the platform where it all initiated,•The Elitesfor managing the event at its best.•	Judges who challenged and uplifted us:Sanya Duggal(Microsoft),Naman Badkul(MakeMyTrip), andYash Chatrath(Sony),•	Our amazing mentorTeeksha Harish(DRDO Intern) for stepping in with just the right advice at the right time,•	And of course,MicrosoftandMicrosoft Azurefor being the ground where this dream unfolded.This moment will stay with us.But more importantly, it fuels everything we’re building next.Thank You.hashtag#Hackamania2025hashtag#HackathonWinnershashtag#BuiltInBharathashtag#DesignedForTheGlobehashtag#MicrosoftIndiahashtag#AIForGoodhashtag#ProductThinkinghashtag#StudentInnovationhashtag#TeamworkMakesTheDreamWorkhashtag#TechForImpacthashtag#FromIdeaToExecutionhashtag#Reskillhashtag#ProblemSolvershashtag#DigitalInnovationhashtag#MadeWithGrithashtag#Hiringhashtag#OpenToWorkhashtag#TechTalenthashtag#LinkedInTech We invest in people through our internship program—and here’s why:Why internships are the only entry point:•	We hire based on potential, not just past experience.•	Internships let us see how you think, work, and grow.•	You’ll earn trust and responsibility by doing real work.•	Most of our full-time team started as interns.•	It’s not a test—it’s your launchpad.What you get as an intern:•	Real projects with real impact—no coffee runs.•	Direct mentorship from experienced professionals.•	Fast-track learning in a collaborative environment.•	A voice in the room—your ideas will be heard.•	A clear path to a full-time role if you crush it.If you’re hungry to learn and ready to build—this is your way in.hashtag#WeAreHiringhashtag#InternshipOpportunityhashtag#GrowWithUshashtag#CareersStartHerehashtag#TeamCulture 🚨 We're Hiring Summer Interns!Harsh Hasthkala is on the lookout for passionate, driven, and creative individuals to join our Summer Internship Program 🌞Whether you're a fresher or looking to gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing personalized gifting startup, this is your chance to shine 💥🎯 Open Roles:🔹 Graphic Designer🔹 Operation Manager🔹 Web Developer🔹 Social Media Manager📩 Apply Now – Freshers are welcome!🧾 Send your CV & portfolio to:harshhasthkala@gmail.com📞 Contact: 7470675398🚀 Work on real projects. We’re Not Just Hiring — We’re Inviting People Into a StoryEvery job post is more than a list of requirements.It’s an invitation — to grow, to build, to belong.So we’re being more intentional about how we talk about open roles.We want candidates to know:✅ What kind of work they’ll do✅ Who they’ll be doing it with✅ What challenges they’ll face — and why they matter✅ What kind of support, leadership, and culture they can expectBecause job seekers today aren’t just looking for a job.They’re looking for meaning, flexibility, growth, and trust.That means hiring can’t just be reactive.It has to reflect who we are and who we’re becoming.If you're applying to our roles — expect honesty, communication, and a team that’s just as invested in your success as you Why are freshers struggling to get a job?Major tech giants (Google, Microsoft, Meta, Apple, Tesla, Palantir, Nvidia) have recorded ZERO net headcount growth since 2022. Our Indian IT companies thankfully are still hiring but only because they are investing in the future.Compare that to the pandemic hiring frenzy when these companies added 120,000+ employees in a single year.What changed? 4 key factors:🔸 Pandemic Overhiring Hangover - Companies are still digesting their 2020-2022 hiring spree as demand normalized🔸 Rising Interest Rates - CFOs prioritizing margin discipline over headcount expansion🔸 AI Infrastructure Investment - Billions diverted to GPUs and data centers, leaving less for junior hires🔸 AI Replacing Entry-Level Work - Copilots and automation tools enabling teams to do more with lessThe traditional link between revenue growth and headcount growth is breaking. Companies are testing whether they can grow without growing their teams.For freshers navigating this storm:✅ Build portfolios, not just résumés✅ Master AI tools in your field✅ Freelance/intern strategically✅ Network beyond LinkedIn✅ Target smaller companies and emerging sectorsThe job market isn't broken—it's evolving. The future belongs to those who adapt early, learn fast, and stay visible. Reach out to us atBe Practical Tech Solutionsto understand how we are playing our role in creating such graduates.But here's the real truth - freshers who understand AI, build real projects, and think like founders aren't just employable—they're unstoppable. You need to stop hiring for roles that shouldn't exist in the first place.Let’s stop pretending you need more people. _Navigating the world of HR: Empathy vs. Experience 💼_My first week as an HR Intern has been a fascinating journey into the realities of recruitment. My background as a customer service representative instilled in me a deep sense of empathy – putting myself in others' shoes  – the ability to truly understand and share the feelings of others. Stepping into an HR role, I initially assumed this skill would directly translate.One early challenge has been reviewing countless CVs, many from individuals who, despite their enthusiasm, don't quite meet the specific requirements for the roles we're currently hiring for. It brings a certain sadness having to turn down these applications. The thought often crosses my mind: "People can learn and grow on the job, can't we offer them a chance, even if their experience isn't a perfect match? Everyone has to start somewhere, right?"I voiced this very question to my boss: "Why can't we process and submit CVs for roles that applicants are passionate about, even if they don't fully meet the stated criteria? Surely, a CV doesn't capture someone's full potential."Her response provided valuable perspective, framed by a simple yet impactful scenario: "If I were a business owner with little or no knowledge of handling social media space seeking a Social Media Manager with a specific level of proven experience, would it be wise to hire someone with absolutely no prior experience in that field?" The answer, undeniably, was "no."This conversation has illuminated a crucial aspect of HR: while empathy is essential in understanding the aspirations of job seekers, effective recruitment also demands a level of strategic discretion to meet the specific needs and goals of the organization.This early stage of my HR journey is already teaching me the importance of this balance. It's about recognizing potential while also ensuring the right fit for the role. hashtag#Francis, you no knowhashtag#personforhashtag#inside, you dihashtag#wasteyourhashtag#time.That was what his classmate told him one evening  in Ngoa-Ekelle.Francis had just sent out his 8th internship application hoping to land something paid before graduation.He smiled quietly. Not because he was sure it would work…But because he knew what he was doing differently.You see, Francis didn’t have any connections.No uncle in the ministry.No big cousin in Bastos.No friend whose aunty works in HR.But he was tired of free internships where he’d work 8 to 5 and go home with nothing but dust on his shoes and “thank you for coming.”Let me summarily put down what Francis did:1. He picked a company in Yaoundé whose work aligned with his business background a clean tech startup in Dragages that recently posted about growth.2. He researched like his future depended on it:He read their website, watched interviews, and even followed the founder on LinkedIn.3. He rewrote his CV and crafted a bold cover letter showing how his school projects and volunteer work could support their marketing efforts.4. Francis didn’t wait for a job ad.He sent a personalized email to their info@ address and followed up with polite persistence.5. When they finally replied, it wasn’t with “We’re hiring.”It was:“We weren’t planning to take interns… but we like your energy. Can you come in next week?”That’s how Francis, a student from Yaoundé II Soa, landed a paid internship in Dragages, with no long leg and no inside help.To every young Cameroonian reading this:Stop waiting for someone to pull you in.Start preparing to walk through the door on your own.Sometimes it’s not about who you knowIt’s about how well you present what you know.hashtag#CareerInCameroonhashtag#InternshipWithoutConnectionhashtag#FrancisStoryhashtag#YaoundeOpportunitieshashtag#PaidInternshipshashtag#CVandCoverLetterTipshashtag#StudentSuccesshashtag#NgoaToDragages hashtag#Francis, you no knowhashtag#personforhashtag#inside, you dihashtag#wasteyourhashtag#time.That was what his classmate told him one evening  in Ngoa-Ekelle.Francis had just sent out his 8th internship application hoping to land something paid before graduation.He smiled quietly. hashtag#Hiringhashtag#Hiringhashtag#HiringWe are excited to invite talented and creative individuals to join Neso Academy. As an App Developer Intern, you will have the unique opportunity to broaden your skill set, work on exciting projects, and gain valuable experience in a dynamic and innovative work environment.Stipend: Rs.10,000 - Rs.15,000/- monthDuration: 6 MonthsLocation: Sector 136, NoidaOpportunity: High-performing interns will be considered for a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) or Full-Time Role post-internship!Responsibilities:As an App Developer Intern, your responsibilities will include assisting the technical team with the mobile application (Android and iOS) development.• Building and maintaining native Android applications using Kotlin• Implementing MVVM architecture and working with Android Jetpack (AndroidX) libraries• Debugging issues and contributing to performance optimizations• Collaborating in code reviews and following best practices for clean, maintainable code• Engaging in real-world problem-solving during app development tasksRequirements:We’re looking for enthusiastic individuals who are eager to learn and contribute. The ideal candidate should have:• A foundational understanding of mobile app development, especially for Android• Familiarity with Kotlin and willingness to explore advanced Android development concepts• Exposure to or basic understanding of MVVM architecture and Jetpack components• Curiosity to solve problems and the ability to adapt quickly to new tools and techniques• A proactive mindset and willingness to take initiative in a collaborative environmentInterested Candidates can share their Updated Resume on:anubhuti.jain@nesoacademy.org Anubhuti JainAnubhuti Jain hashtag#Hiringhashtag#Hiringhashtag#HiringWe are excited to invite talented and creative individuals to join Neso Academy. hashtag#hiring*Architectural Intern*, Calgary, *Canada*, fulltimehashtag#opentoworkhashtag#Calgaryjobshashtag#Albertajobshashtag#Constructionhashtag#entrylevelhashtag#firstjobhashtag#newgradhashtag#internshiphashtag#entryleveljobs*To Apply -->*:https://lnkd.in/djpFVybyFor over four decades, Evans has been the global leader in providing innovative solutions for mission-critical operations. We serve a diverse client base, including public safety, aviation, process control, utilities, and technology, as well as numerous government agencies. With the industry's largest portfolio of projects worldwide, serving 15 industries, it's our proven methodology, strict quality standards, and experience that make the difference for our customers. Looking for an Architectural Technologist (Level 2) to join our expanding Construction Team in Calgary, AB.The Architectural Intern will work under the supervision of the Project Architect as an integral member of a Design Team specializing in the development of high-quality design solutions across a multitude of industries. This role provides an opportunity to gain hands-on experience in space programming, field surveying, architectural + interior design, detailed computer modelling, and construction documentation + administration.
